p: Figure 3 shows the relationship between tyrosinase concentration and the reaction velocity. All of the resultant plots passed through the origin point, whereas the slope decreased with the increase in p‐CAEE concentration. The trend is consistent with the characteristics of reversible inhibitors (Kubo et al., 2003). These results indicate that the inhibition of the p‐CAEE on tyrosinase was reversible by noncovalent bonds. The enzyme can be reactivated by physical removal of the bonds or inhibitors (Chen & Kubo, 2002).
